etymology.description: 入(入) (rù, "enter") + 一(一) (yī, "one") = gathering from three sides
etymology.interpretation: The character 亼 captures the concept of convergence or assembly, symbolizing items coming together from three sides. The elements suggest a process of collection or formation.

examples.chinese: 游客们亼在博物馆前(遊客們亼在博物館前)，等待讲解(等待講解)。
examples.pinyin: Yóukèmen jí zài bówùguǎn qián, děngdài jiǎngjiě.
examples.english: The tourists gathered in front of the museum, waiting for an explanation.

examples.chinese: 同学们亼在图书馆内(同學們亼在圖書館內)，共同学习(共同學習)。
examples.pinyin: Tóngxuémen jí zài túshūguǎn nèi, gòngtóng xuéxí.
examples.english: The classmates gathered inside the library, studying together.

examples.chinese: 村民们亼在古老广场上(村民們亼在古老廣場上)，庆祝丰收(慶祝豐收)。
examples.pinyin: Cūnmínmen jí zài gǔlǎo guǎngchǎng shàng, qìngzhù fēngshōu.
examples.english: The villagers gathered in the old square, celebrating the harvest.
